isis.stitle: ANTILOCK BRAKES/TRACTION CONTROL: BENDIX - PRINCIPLES, OPERATION AND SERVICE - OPERATION

svcproc.title: NORMAL BRAKING REAR AXLE(S)
svcproc.para: During normal braking, control air pressure from the brake valve (foot valve) enters the service port of the service relay valve (part of the controller/relay valve assembly). The relay valve also receives air from the vehicle's primary air reservoir. The service relay delivers air to, and through, the antilock modulators located near the braked wheel(s), and into the brake actuator. The service brakes are thus applied. If the wheel sensors do not detect an imbalance (impending wheel lockup), the controller does not initiate any corrective action and the vehicle comes to a stop in a normal fashion.
